entries.title: Chip stocks rally on optimistic AMD earnings and Fed's signal that inflation is easing
entries.description: Chip stocks like NVIDIA, Qualcomm and Broadcom were boosted after the Federal Reserve rose the federal funds rate by 0.25 percentage point on Wednesday.

entries.title: Bond king Jeffrey Gundlach says he expects one more Fed rate hike
entries.description: DoubleLine Capital CEO Jeffrey Gundlach said he sees one additional rate hike from the Federal Reserve before the central bank ends its tightening cycle.

entries.title: Meta shares jump 17% on fourth-quarter revenue beat
entries.description: Facebook-parent Meta reported revenue for the fourth quarter that topped estimates and gave a forecast suggesting that sales could rise in the first quarter.

entries.title: Meta lost $13.7 billion on Reality Labs in 2022 as Zuckerberg's metaverse bet gets pricier
entries.description: In its first full year as a separate business, Meta's Reality Labs unit racked up costs, closing with a $13.7 billion operating loss in the fourth quarter.

entries.title: Saudi Aramco backs Brooklyn-based startup turning ammonia into fuel
entries.description: Amogy is a startup that is experimenting with ammonia as fuel for heavy duty transportation, like trucking and shipping. The startup is backed by Saudi Aramco.

entries.title: Samsung launches new Galaxy S23 smartphone lineup with improved camera, gaming capabilities
entries.description: Samsung launched its new Galaxy S23 smartphone lineup Wednesday. The S23 will go head-to-head with Apple's iPhone 14.

entries.title: Early retiree says breaking these 6 ‘society rules’ helped him save $1 million: 'I wasn't born rich'
entries.description: Early retiree Steve Adcock saved $1 million by working 9-to-5 jobs, investing well, and breaking society rules. Here's his best advice for achieving a successful life.

entries.title: FBI searching Biden home in Rehoboth, Delaware, in classified documents probe
entries.description: The Department of Justice is investigating the discovery of classified records found at private locations tied to both President Joe Biden and Donald Trump.

entries.title: Here's everything the Fed is expected to do Wednesday
entries.description: This week's Federal Reserve meeting will be remembered more for what policymakers say than what they do.

entries.title: OPEC+ committee recommends no change in oil output policy at virtual meeting
entries.description: A technical committee of the influential OPEC+ oil producers' coalition has made no recommendation to change the group's existing production policy in its latest meeting, according to three delegates.

entries.title: Mortgage demand took a big step back last week, even after interest rates fell further
entries.description: Total mortgage application volume fell 9% last week compared with the previous week.

entries.title: Enzo Fernandez: Chelsea sign midfielder in £106.8m British-record transfer deal from Benfica
entries.description: The deal for the Argentine surpasses the £100m Manchester City paid for Jack Grealish from Aston Villa 18 months ago.

entries.title: Gold demand surged to an 11-year high in 2022 on 'colossal' central bank buying
entries.description: Gold demand soared to an 11-year high in 2022 on the back of "colossal central bank purchases, aided by vigorous retail investor buying," according to the World Gold Council.

entries.title: Euro zone inflation dips for a third straight month as energy prices continue to fall
entries.description: Inflation in the euro zone dropped for a third consecutive month in January.

entries.title: Adani vs. Hindenburg: How Asia’s richest man lost his crown in just a few days
entries.description: How Adani Group's founder once named the richest man in Asia and once second only to Elon Musk, lost nearly $70 billion in days

entries.title: Missing radioactive capsule found on roadside in Western Australia after week-long search
entries.description: The device, used in Rio Tinto's mining operations, fell off the back of a truck as it was taken by a third-party specialist for repairs.

entries.title: Iron ore prices could rally as one leading producer remains reluctant to share, analyst says
entries.description: India's exports of iron ore plunged by 90% year on year in October last year, and recorded an year-on-year decline as steep as 96% in September.

entries.title: Concerns about golden eagles are partly prompting the redesign of a Scottish wind farm
entries.description: Decision to reduce the number of turbines for the Scoop Hill Community Wind Farm follows a period of consultation for the project.

entries.title: Britain hit by biggest strike in more than a decade with schools shut and rail networks disrupted
entries.description: Teachers, train and bus drivers, civil servants and university staff are joining a mass walk-out on Wednesday.

entries.title: Major central banks set to signal interest rate glide path in crucial week for monetary policy
entries.description: Major central banks are expected to hike interest rates once again this week, but will be watched for signs of leading in soft economic landings.

entries.title: Britain sets out plans to regulate crypto industry in wake of FTX collapse
entries.description: In December, a U.K. minister suggested FTX's failure had reinforced the need for urgent crypto regulation. Now, the government has unveiled its plans.

entries.title: Sticky inflation means the European Central Bank could be far from a policy pivot
entries.description: The European Central Bank is set to hike interest rates again on Thursday, with policymakers in Frankfurt shifting their focus to core inflation and trying to predict when sky-high consumer prices might fall.

entries.title: India may have to walk a tightrope as budget looms, analysts say
entries.description: India's Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will announce the last full-year budget before  the next general elections in 2024.

entries.title: Luxury stocks rally from China reopening, but world's largest luxury market may choose to shop 'in-house'
entries.description: Years of zero-Covid measures have taught Chinese consumers they can get their fix of opulence on their own shores — and experts say this habit is here to stay.

entries.title: South Korea posts the worst trade deficit in its history
entries.description: South Korea saw the worst trade deficit since the agency started compiling data in 1956 and more than the $20.6 billion trade deficit seen in 1996.

entries.title: Google is asking employees to test potential ChatGPT competitors, including a chatbot called 'Apprentice Bard'
entries.description: Google is testing chatbots similar to ChatGPT that use its LaMDA technology, as well as new search page designs that integrate the technology.

entries.title: Indonesia's seafood farming industry faces a 'technology gap' — and startups are raising big bucks to fill it
entries.description: "A lot of decisions made are based on gut feeling or what ancestors have been doing for the past 60 years," says one startup's co-founder and CEO.
